00034 template<typename ForwardIterator, typename T, typename CMP> bool
00035 continousFind( ForwardIterator &current, const ForwardIterator end, const T &compare, CMP compOp )
00036 {
00037     //find the first iterator which is does not compare less
00038     current = std::lower_bound( current, end, compare, compOp );
00039 
00040     if ( current == end //if we're at the end
00041          || compOp( compare, *current ) //or compare is less than that iterator
00042        )
00043         return false;//we didn't find a match
00044     else
00045         return true;//not(current <> compare) makes compare == current
00046 }
00047 }

00067 // The core tree traversal functions
00069 PropertyMap::mapped_type &PropertyMap::fetchEntry( const key_type &key )
00070 {
00071     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00072     return fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00073 }
00078 PropertyMap::mapped_type &PropertyMap::fetchEntry(
00079     PropertyMap &root,
00080     const isis::util::PropertyMap::propPathIterator at, const isis::util::PropertyMap::propPathIterator pathEnd )
00081 {
00082     propPath::const_iterator next = at;
00083     next++;
00084     Container &rootRef = root;
00085     iterator found = root.find( *at );
00086 
00087     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (a proposed leaf in the PropMap)
00088         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00089             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00090             LOG_IF( ref.is_leaf(), Runtime, error )
00091                     << util::MSubject( found->first ) << " is a leaf, but was requested as a branch in "
00092                     << util::MSubject( util::listToString( at, pathEnd, "/" ) );
00093             return fetchEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00094         } else { // if we should create a sub-map
00095             //insert a empty branch (aka PropMap) at "*at" (and fetch the reference of that)
00096             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating an empty branch " << *at << " trough fetching";
00097             return fetchEntry( rootRef[*at].getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); // and continue there
00098         }
00099     } else { //if its the leaf
00100         LOG_IF( rootRef.find( *at ) == rootRef.end() , Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating an empty entry " << *at << " trough fetching";
00101         return rootRef[*at]; // (create and) return that entry
00102     }
00103 }
00104 
00105 const PropertyMap::mapped_type *PropertyMap::findEntry( const key_type &key )const
00106 {
00107     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00108     return findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00109 }
00114 const PropertyMap::mapped_type *PropertyMap::findEntry(
00115     const PropertyMap &root,
00116     const propPathIterator at, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00117 {
00118     propPathIterator next = at;
00119     next++;
00120     util::PropertyMap::const_iterator found = root.find( *at );
00121 
00122     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (aka the leaf)
00123         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00124             const mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00125             return findEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00126         }
00127     } else if ( found != root.end() ) {// if its the leaf and we found the entry
00128         return &found->second; // return that entry
00129     }
00130 
00131     return NULL;
00132 }
00133 bool PropertyMap::recursiveRemove( PropertyMap &root, const propPathIterator path_it, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00134 {
00135     bool ret = false;
00136 
00137     if ( path_it != pathEnd ) {
00138         propPathIterator next = path_it;
00139         next++;
00140         iterator found = root.find( *path_it );
00141 
00142         if ( found != root.end() ) {
00143             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00144 
00145             if ( ! ref.is_leaf() ) {
00146                 ret = recursiveRemove( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd );
00147 
00148                 if ( ref.getBranch().isEmpty() )
00149                     root.erase( found ); // remove the now empty branch
00150             } else {
00151                 root.erase( found );
00152                 ret = true;
00153             }
00154         } else {
00155             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Entry " << util::MSubject( *path_it ) << " not found, skipping it";
00156         }
00157     }
00158 
00159     return ret;
00160 }

00164 // Generic interface for accessing elements
00166 const PropertyValue &PropertyMap::propertyValue( const key_type &key )const
00167 {
00168     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00169     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00170 
00171     if( ref && ref->is_leaf() ) {
00172         return ref->getLeaf();
00173     } else {
00174         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Property " << key << " not found. Returning empty property.";
00175         return emptyEntry.getLeaf();
00176     }
00177 }
00178 
00179 PropertyValue &PropertyMap::propertyValue( const key_type &key )
00180 {
00181     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00182     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00183     LOG_IF( ! n.is_leaf(), Debug, error ) << "Using branch " << key << " as PropertyValue";
00184     return n.getLeaf();
00185 }
00186 
00187 const PropertyMap &PropertyMap::branch( const key_type &key ) const
00188 {
00189     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00190     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00191 
00192     if( ! ref ) {
00193         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Trying to access non existing branch " << key << ".";
00194         return emptyEntry.getBranch();
00195     } else {
00196         LOG_IF( ref->getBranch().isEmpty(), Runtime, warning ) << "Accessing empty branch " << key;
00197         return ref->getBranch();
00198     }
00199 }
00200 PropertyMap &PropertyMap::branch( const key_type &key )
00201 {
00202     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00203     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00204     return n.getBranch();
00205 }

00207 bool PropertyMap::remove( const key_type &key )
00208 {
00209     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00210     return recursiveRemove( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00211 }
00212 
00213 bool PropertyMap::remove( const isis::util::PropertyMap &removeMap, bool keep_needed )
00214 {
00215     iterator thisIt = begin();
00216     bool ret = true;
00217 
00218     //remove everything that is also in second
00219     for ( const_iterator otherIt = removeMap.begin(); otherIt != removeMap.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00220         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00221         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first - so its the same property or propmap
00222             if ( ! thisIt->second.is_leaf() ) { //this is a branch
00223                 if ( ! otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) { // recurse if its a branch in the removal map as well
00224                     PropertyMap &mySub = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00225                     const PropertyMap &otherSub = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00226                     ret &= mySub.remove( otherSub );
00227 
00228                     if( mySub.isEmpty() ) // delete my branch, if its empty
00229                         erase( thisIt++ );
00230                 } else {
00231                     LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Not deleting branch " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " because its no subtree in the removal map";
00232                     ret = false;
00233                 }
00234             } else if( !( thisIt->second.getLeaf().isNeeded() && keep_needed ) ) { // this is a leaf
00235                 erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00236             }
00237         }
00238     }
00239 
00240     return ret;
00241 }

00245 // utilities
00247 bool PropertyMap::isValid() const
00248 {
00249     //iterate through the whole map and return false as soon as we find something needed _and_ empty
00250     const const_iterator found = std::find_if( begin(), end(), treeInvalidP() );
00251     return found == end();
00252 }

00255 {
00256     return Container::empty();

00259 PropertyMap::DiffMap PropertyMap::getDifference( const PropertyMap &other ) const
00260 {
00261     PropertyMap::DiffMap ret;
00262     diffTree( other, ret, "" );
00263     return ret;
00264 }
00265 
00266 void PropertyMap::diffTree( const PropertyMap &other, PropertyMap::DiffMap &ret, istring prefix ) const
00267 {
00268     const_iterator otherIt = other.begin();
00269 
00270     //insert everything that is in this, but not in second or is on both but differs
00271     for ( const_iterator thisIt = begin(); thisIt != end(); thisIt++ ) {
00272         const propPath::value_type pathname = prefix + thisIt->first;
00273 
00274         //find the closest match for thisIt->first in other (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00275         if ( _internal::continousFind( otherIt, other.end(), *thisIt, value_comp() ) ) { //otherIt->first == thisIt->first - so its the same property
00276             const mapped_type &first = thisIt->second, &second = otherIt->second;
00277 
00278             if ( ! ( first.is_leaf() || second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a branch
00279                 const PropertyMap &thisMap = first.getBranch();
00280                 const PropertyMap &refMap = second.getBranch();
00281                 thisMap.diffTree( refMap, ret, pathname + "/" );
00282             } else if ( ! ( first == second )  ) { // if they are not equal
00283                 const PropertyValue firstVal = first.is_leaf() ? first.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( first.toString() ) );
00284                 const PropertyValue secondVal = second.is_leaf() ? second.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( second.toString() ) );
00285                 ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|value2))
00286                     ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00287                     std::make_pair(
00288                         pathname,   //the key
00289                         std::make_pair( firstVal, secondVal ) //pair of both values
00290                     )
00291                 );
00292             }
00293         } else { // if ref is not in the other map
00294             const PropertyValue firstVal = thisIt->second.is_leaf() ? thisIt->second.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( thisIt->second.toString() ) );
00295             ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|[empty]))
00296                 ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00297                 std::make_pair(
00298                     pathname,
00299                     std::make_pair( firstVal, PropertyValue() )
00300                 )
00301             );
00302         }
00303     }
00304 
00305     //insert everything that is in second but not in this
00306     const_iterator thisIt = begin();
00307 
00308     for ( otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00309         const propPath::value_type pathname = prefix + otherIt->first;
00310 
00311         if ( ! _internal::continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //there is nothing in this which has the same key as ref
00312             const PropertyValue secondVal = otherIt->second.is_leaf() ? otherIt->second.getLeaf() : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( otherIt->second.toString() ) );
00313             ret.insert(
00314                 std::make_pair( // add (propertyname|([empty]|value2))
00315                     pathname,
00316                     std::make_pair( PropertyValue(), secondVal )
00317                 )
00318             );
00319         }
00320     }
00321 }
00322 
00323 void PropertyMap::removeEqual ( const util::PropertyMap &other, bool removeNeeded )
00324 {
00325     iterator thisIt = begin();
00326 
00327     //remove everything that is also in second and equal (or also empty)
00328     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00329         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00330         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first  - so its the same property
00331             if ( ! removeNeeded && thisIt->second.getLeaf().isNeeded() ) {//Skip needed
00332                 thisIt++;
00333                 continue;
00334             }
00335 
00336             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { //this is empty
00337                 if ( otherIt->second.empty() ) { //the other is empty
00338                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00339                 } else {
00340                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping the empty " << thisIt->first << " because its is not empty in the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00341                     thisIt++;
00342                 }
00343             } else if ( ! otherIt->second.empty() ) { // if the other is not empty as well
00344                 if ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) { //delete this, if they are equal
00345                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Removing " << *thisIt << " because its equal with the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00346                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00347                 } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { //but maybe they are branches
00348                     PropertyMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00349                     const PropertyMap &otherMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00350                     thisMap.removeEqual( otherMap );
00351                     thisIt++;
00352                 }
00353             } else {//only the other is empty
00354                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping " << *thisIt << " because the other is empty";
00355                 thisIt++;
00356             }
00357         }
00358     }
00359 }

00362 PropertyMap::KeyList PropertyMap::join( const isis::util::PropertyMap &other, bool overwrite )
00363 {
00364     KeyList rejects;
00365     joinTree( other, overwrite, "", rejects );
00366     return rejects;
00367 }
00368 
00369 void PropertyMap::joinTree( const isis::util::PropertyMap &other, bool overwrite, util::istring prefix, PropertyMap::KeyList &rejects )
00370 {
00371     iterator thisIt = begin();
00372 
00373     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) { //iterate through the elements of other
00374         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { // if the element is allready here
00375             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { // if ours is empty
00376                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Replacing empty property " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00377                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00378             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a subtree
00379                 PropertyMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00380                 const PropertyMap &refMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00381                 thisMap.joinTree( refMap, overwrite, prefix + thisIt->first + "/", rejects ); //recursion
00382             } else if ( overwrite ) { // otherwise replace ours by the other (if we shall overwrite)
00383                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Replacing property " << MSubject( *thisIt ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00384                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00385             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) ) { // otherwise put the other into rejected if its not equal to our
00386                 LOG( Debug, info )
00387                         << "Rejecting property " << MSubject( *otherIt )
00388                         << " because " << MSubject( thisIt->second ) << " is allready there";
00389                 rejects.insert( rejects.end(), prefix + otherIt->first );
00390             }
00391         } else { // ok we dont have that - just insert it
00392             std::pair<const_iterator, bool> inserted = insert( *otherIt );
00393             LOG_IF( inserted.second, Debug, verbose_info ) << "Inserted property " << MSubject( *inserted.first ) << ".";
00394         }
00395     }
00396 }

00399 void PropertyMap::makeFlatMap( FlatMap &out, key_type key_prefix ) const
00400 {
00401     for ( const_iterator i = begin(); i != end(); i++ ) {
00402         key_type key = ( key_prefix.empty() ? "" : key_prefix + pathSeperator ) + i->first;
00403 
00404         if ( i->second.is_leaf()  ) {
00405             out.insert( std::make_pair( key, i->second.getLeaf() ) );
00406         } else {
00407             i->second.getBranch().makeFlatMap( out, key );
00408         }
00409     }
00410 }
00411 
00412 PropertyMap::FlatMap PropertyMap::getFlatMap() const
00413 {
00414     isis::util::PropertyMap::FlatMap buff;
00415     makeFlatMap( buff );
00416     return buff;
00417 }

00420 bool PropertyMap::transform( key_type from,  key_type to, int dstID, bool delSource )
00421 {
00422     const PropertyValue &found = propertyValue( from );
00423     bool ret = false;
00424 
00425     if( ! found.isEmpty() ) {
00426         util::ValueReference &dst = static_cast<util::ValueReference &>( propertyValue( to ) );
00427 
00428         if ( found->getTypeID() == dstID ) {
00429             if( from != to ) {
00430                 dst = found ;
00431                 ret = true;
00432             } else {
00433                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " into same type at same place.";
00434             }
00435         } else {
00436             LOG_IF( from == to, Debug, warning ) << "Transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " in place.";
00437             dst = found->copyToNewByID( dstID );
00438             ret = !dst.isEmpty();
00439         }
00440     }
00441 
00442     if ( ret && delSource )remove( from );
00443 
00444     return ret;
00445 }

00469 void PropertyMap::addNeededFromString( const std::string &needed )
00470 {
00471     const std::list<std::string> needList = util::stringToList<std::string>( needed );
00472     //@todo util::stringToList<std::string>( needed,' ' ) would be faster but less robust
00473     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Adding " << needed << " as needed";
00474     BOOST_FOREACH( std::list<std::string>::const_reference ref, needList ) {
00475         addNeeded( key_type( ref.c_str() ) );
00476     }
00477 }

00480 bool PropertyMap::hasProperty( const key_type &key ) const
00481 {
00482     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00483     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00484     return ( ref && ref->is_leaf() && ! ref->getLeaf().isEmpty() );
00485 }
00487 bool PropertyMap::hasBranch( const key_type &key ) const
00488 {
00489     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00490     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00491     return ( ref && ! ref->is_leaf()  );
00492 }
00493 
00494 bool PropertyMap::rename( key_type oldname, key_type newname )
00495 {
00496     const mapped_type *old_e = findEntry( oldname );
00497     const mapped_type *new_e = findEntry( newname );
00498 
00499     if ( old_e ) {
00500         LOG_IF( new_e && ! new_e->empty(), Runtime, warning )
00501                 << "Overwriting " << std::make_pair( newname, *new_e ) << " with " << *old_e;
00502         fetchEntry( newname ) = *old_e;
00503         return remove( oldname );
00504     } else {
00505         LOG( Runtime, warning )
00506                 << "Cannot rename " << oldname << " it does not exist";
00507         return false;
00508     }
00509 }
00510 
00511 void PropertyMap::toCommonUnique( PropertyMap &common, std::set<key_type> &uniques, bool init )const
00512 {
00513     if ( init ) {
00514         common = *this;
00515         uniques.clear();
00516         return;
00517     } else {
00518         const DiffMap difference = common.getDifference( *this );
00519         BOOST_FOREACH( const DiffMap::value_type & ref, difference ) {
00520             uniques.insert( ref.first );
00521 
00522             if ( ! ref.second.first.isEmpty() )common.remove( ref.first );//if there is something in common, remove it
00523         }
00524     }
00525 }
00526 
00527 std::ostream &PropertyMap::print( std::ostream &out, bool label )const
00528 {
00529     FlatMap buff;
00530     makeFlatMap( buff );
00531     size_t key_len = 0;
00532 
00533     for ( FlatMap::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00534         if ( key_len < i->first.length() )
00535             key_len = i->first.length();
00536 
00537     for ( FlatMap::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00538         out << i->first << std::string( key_len - i->first.length(), ' ' ) + ":" << i->second.toString( label ) << std::endl;
00539 
00540     return out;
00541 }
00542 
00543 bool PropertyMap::trueP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &/*ref*/ ) const
00544 {
00545     return true;
00546 }
00547 bool PropertyMap::invalidP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &ref ) const
00548 {
00549     return ref.second.getLeaf().isNeeded() && ref.second.getLeaf().isEmpty();
00550 }
00551 bool PropertyMap::treeInvalidP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &ref ) const
00552 {
00553     if ( ref.second.is_leaf() ) {
00554         const PropertyValue &val = ref.second.getLeaf();
00555         return val.isNeeded() && val.isEmpty();
00556     } else  {
00557         return ! ref.second.getBranch().isValid();
00558     }
00559 }
